results.title: It's a very merry Muppet Christmas movie
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, National Broadcasting Company, Jim Henson, Martin G. Baker, Warren Carr and Kirk Thatcher
results.brief_description: It’s the night before Christmas and the Muppet Theatre is under threat of being demolished. Stars the usual Muppet gang of Miss Piggy, Kermit and others, who all rally and with some divine intervention and funny send-ups of holiday movie cliches, to reveal the film’s message is love will save the day (as well as a good song and dance number!). Humans that also feature are David Arquette, Joan Cusack and Whoopi Goldberg. Directed by Kirk R Thatcher and produced by Martin G Baker and Warren Carr.

results.title: It's a small world
results.creator_credit: British Information Services, Lewis Gilbert and Brian Smith
results.brief_description: Life in a typical nursery school in Britain, capturing their involvement in games, painting, modelling, climbing and acting and ending with a birthday tea party and a dip in a pool. Traditional gender roles can be observed as the girls cook in the kitchen, while the boys occupy themselves with building. A non-narrated film with musical accompaniment.

results.title: It's a new world!
results.creator_credit: Venture Film Services and Amateur Swimming Association
results.brief_description: Shows the advantages of swimming for the physically disabled, focusing extensively on the methods of holding handicapped children in water to build water-confidence and compensate for the lack of movement on land. Looks at ways children with disabilities have overcome their handicaps and some of the achievements of the disabled in their sport.

results.title: It's a mad mad mad mad world
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation and Stanley Kramer
results.brief_description: A mammoth cast includes Spencer Tracy, Milton Berle, Sid Caeser, Buddy Hackett, Ethel Merman, Mickey Rooney, Dick Shawn, Phil Silvers, Terry Thomas, Jonathan Winters, Edie Adams, Dorothy Provine, Peter Falk and Jimmy Durante. Kramer’s film recalls the zany slapstick era of silent films. Durante is a dying millionaire who gives a secret clue to the location of his buried fortune. Everyone is out to beat everyone else to the loot and nothing is done in moderation. Every obstacle is put in the path of the treasure-seekers and dealt with in unexpected or illogical ways. With this bevy of comic actors, no single performance shines and the laughs abound.

results.creator_credit: Laurie Kirkwood, David Poltorak and AFTRS

results.title: It's a hobby for Harvey
results.creator_credit: Barry Lank Productions and Barry Lank
results.brief_description: Shows champion whistler Harvey Pollock, a Canadian lawyer by profession, as he performs at regional contests and programs and with the Winnipeg Symphony Orchestra. Pollock’s love of whistling carries over to his personal life as he is seen warbling the strains of classical music at home, in his automobile, on horseback, in the swimming pool, and on his boat.

results.title: It's a dangerous world
results.brief_description: An informational film promoting the benefits of undertaking a first aid course by alerting viewers to a myriad of domestic hazards. Shows the attitude of an ordinary person to accidents in all fields. The extent of deaths and injuries from accidents; how various types of accidents happen.

results.title: It's a crime
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Wolf Koenig
results.brief_description: An animated film, in a humorous vein, showing how seasonal unemployment may be greatly lessened if industry, and the public generally, avail themselves of the increased labor supply during winter lay-offs. The advice comes from someone who knows—a gentleman thief and safecracker whose nefarious but highly skilled profession gives him a particular advantage in assessing the state of business, and the contents of strong boxes, during the winter fall-off of work. How the situation may be rectified with a little foresight and imagination is amply and amusingly illustrated. Animation by Gerald Potterton and commentary by Guy Glover.
